content: Zheng Li - Queen's University Belfast View Scopus Profile Zheng Li Dr Lecturer, School of Electronics, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9704-7651 Phone+44 (0)28 9097 5494Emailzheng.liqub.acuk Room 01.014 - Computer Science BuildingUnited Kingdom Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projects1. Empirical Software Engineering (Systematic Reviews/Mapping; Mining Software Repositories)2. Cloud/Edge Computing (Containerisation; Performance Engineering; Edge/Tiny Machine Learning)3. Cloud-/IoT-native Software Engineering (DevOps; Microservices Architecture; Agile Development at Scale)4. Software-driven Data Analytics (Data Gravity/Friction Management; Design-time Privacy/Security Preservation)Our group is seeking self-motivated PhD students. Self-funded PhD candidates, CSC scholarship candidates and visiting PhD students are always welcome. The funding opportunities can be explored via http://www.postgraduate-funding.com/gateway 20102025 Research activity per year Personal profile Research InterestsMy original research background is empirical software engineering. Since my Ph.D. work was part a cloud computing project, my research trajectory and interests closely follow the evolution path of cloud-native software engineering (that extends traditional software engineering to covering the DevOps, cloud, container, and microservice technologies), towards the emerging computing paradigms from mobile cloud computing to edge computing and Internet of Things (IoT). Recently I am involved in two scientific AI projects that both deploy their software infrastructure to the cloud, so I am also interested in the emerging topic software engineering for artificial intelligence (SE4AI). Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
